subject: Physical Fitness
title: Cracking Joints Myth
description: Learn Cracking Joints Myth in one minute.

hook.text: Crack your knuckles and someone will warn you about arthritis. This myth has persisted for over a century.

buildup.text: Joint cracking produces a sound when gas bubbles in synovial fluid collapse rapidly. It's called cavitation.

discovery.text: A doctor cracked only his left knuckles for 60 years to test the myth. Neither hand developed arthritis.

twist.text: Large studies confirm no link between habitual joint cracking and arthritis. The sound is harmless.

punchline.text: Joints crack, pop, and click. Without pain, it's just noise â€” not damage.

quiz.question: What does research show about the link between joint cracking and arthritis?
options: Studies confirm no link between habitual joint cracking and arthritis
